alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Trumbull County through 615 PM EDT... At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Orwell, or 16 miles north of Warren, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, heavy rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warren, Niles, Hubbard, Cortland, Lordstown, Kinsman, North Bloomfield, Vienna Center, Hilltop, Maplewood Park, Bristolville, Leavittsburg, Girard, Vienna, McDonald, Mecca, Johnston, Orangeville, Yankee Lake and Churchill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
